intro: Barbacenia scabrida, commonly known as the rough barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Barbacenia scabrida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
